snippet: President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said the sanctions would not change Iran’s position in a nuclear dispute.
abstract: Iranian Pres Mahmoud Ahmadinejad acknowledges that new sanctions imposed by Western powers are the most onerous ever, but says they will have no impact on the Iranian position in a protracted dispute over its nuclear energy activities; comments come as Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps defiantly begins test-firing missiles capable of hitting Israeli and American military bases in the Middle East.

byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Artin Afkhami contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said the sanctions would not change Iran’s position in a nuclear dispute.

headline.seo: Iran’s President Says New Sanctions Are Toughest Yet
headline.main: Iran’s President Says New Sanctions Are Toughest Yet
headline.print_headline: Sanctions Are Toughest Yet For Iranians, Leader Says
